Method Detail

toMap

public static <U,V> Map<U,V> toMap(Object... keysAndValues)
Puts all the keys and values from the specified array into a new map.

A replacement for the Apache Commons MapUtils#putAll(Map, Object[]) method. That one is very useful but requires a (usually empty) map as an input parameter and does not support generics, leading to lots of casts and @SuppressWarnings declarations.

Use with care: The method may well support generics, but it is not runtime typesafe! Because the runtime type of the map is <Object, Object>, values not compatible with the generic type declaration can be inserted (without causing an error!) if the keysAndValues argument is not properly constructed.

This can lead to tricky ClassCastExceptions, potentially in very distant parts of the code.

Type Parameters:
U - the type of the keys
V - the type of the values
Parameters:
keysAndValues - an array of keys and values (the item at index i is treated as the key, i+1 is the value) to be added
Returns:
a new map containing the keys and values added
Throws:
cf. - org.apache.commons.collections.MapUtils#putAll(Map, Object[])
See Also:
toMap(Map, Object...), org.apache.commons.collections.MapUtils#putAll(Map, Object[])

toMap

public static <T extends Map<?,?>> T toMap(T targetMap,
                                           Object... keysAndValues)
Puts all the keys and values from the specified array into the target map. This enables the caller to determine the map subclass used.

A replacement for the org.apache.commons.collections.MapUtils#putAll(Map, Object[]) method, supporting generics.

Use with care: The method may well support generics, but it is not runtime typesafe! Because the runtime type of the map is <Object, Object>, values not compatible with the generic type declaration can be inserted (without causing an error!) if the keysAndValues argument is not properly constructed.

This can lead to tricky ClassCastExceptions, potentially in very distant parts of the code.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the target map
Parameters:
targetMap - the map to which the key/value pairs are to be added
keysAndValues - an array of keys and values (the item at index i is treated as the key, i+1 is the value) to be added
Returns:
a new map containing the keys and values added
Throws:
cf. - org.apache.commons.collections.MapUtils#putAll(Map, Object[])
See Also:
toMap(Map, Object...), org.apache.commons.collections.MapUtils#putAll(Map, Object[])
